recipes.name: Grilled Chicken Salad
recipes.origin: This became popular in USA in the 20th century
recipes.serve_size: 3-4 ounces of grilled chicken, a vadriety of salad greens and other toppings such as tomatoes, cucumber and dressing
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush chicken with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice thinly.
In a large bowl, combine salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, feta cheese, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, salt, and black pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Top salad with sliced grilled chicken and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chicken Stir-Fry
recipes.origin: Chinese cuisine, it became popular in mid-20th century
recipes.serve_size: 3-4 ounces of coocked chicken, a variety of vegetables such as broccoli, carrots, peppers and small amount of rice or noodles
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into thin strips
steps: In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over high heat.
Add the chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Add the peppers, onion, garlic, and ginger powder and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, cornstarch, and water. Add the mixture to the skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until the sauce has thickened.
Serve the stir-fry over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.origin: Pasta dish from Rome in the World War II
recipes.serve_size: 2-4 ounces of cooked spaghetti, with 1-2 ounces of pancetta or guanciale, amd a source made with 1-2 beaten eggs, and a small amount of cheese
steps: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the bacon and garlic. Remove the skillet from the heat and add the egg mixture, stirring quickly to coat the spaghetti.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
recipes.serve_size: 3-4 ounces of coocked beef, a variety of vegetables such as broccoli, carrots, peppers and small amount of rice or noodles
ingredients: 1 lb flank steak, sliced thinly against the grain
steps: In a small bowl, mix together oyster sauce, soy sauce, cornstarch, and beef broth. Set aside.
In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
Add garlic and ginger to the skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the sliced bell pepper and broccoli florets to the skillet and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Return the beef to the skillet and pour the oyster sauce mixture over the top. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until the sauce thickens and coats the ingredients.
Serve the beef and broccoli stir-fry over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Stuffed Peppers
recipes.serve_size: One whole pepper filled with a mixture of cooked rice, beans and vegetables.
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, halved and seeded
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Place bell pepper halves in a large baking dish and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened.
Add cooked quinoa, black beans, diced tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Spoon the quinoa and bean mixture into each pepper half, filling to the top.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 35-40 minutes.
Remove the foil from the baking dish and sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the top of the stuffed peppers.
Bake for an additional 5-10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Linguine
recipes.serve_size: 2-3 ounce of cooked linguine pasta with a serving of 3-4 medium-sized shrimp, and a sauce made with garlic butter, lemon juicee and Parmesan cheese
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the linguine pasta and cook according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of the pasta cooking water and set aside.
While the pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and cooked through.
Add the lemon zest and juice, chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Add the cooked linguine pasta to the skillet with the shrimp and toss to coat in the lemon garlic sauce. If the pasta seems dry, add some of the reserved pasta cooking water to loosen the sauce.
Serve hot with grated Parmesan cheese on top.

recipes.name: Moroccan Chickpea Stew
recipes.serve_size: Small bowl or cup with a serving of cooked chickpeas and lentils, vegetables such as carrots & onions, and flavorful broth made with spices and tomato
steps: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened.
Add tomato paste, cumin, cinnamon, ginger, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the pot. Stir well to combine.
Add chickpeas, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, carrots, sweet potato, and raisins to the pot. Stir well to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the flavors are well combined.
Serve hot over cooked couscous and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Salmon Bowl
recipes.serve_size: Medium-sized salmon fillet, cooked rice, and a variety of vegetables, with a generous drizzle of teriyaki sauce
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a small bowl, whisk together teriyaki sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger.
Place salmon fillets in a baking dish and pour the teriyaki sauce mixture over the top. Turn the fillets to coat in the sauce.
Bake the salmon for 12-15 minutes until cooked through and flaky.
Assemble the bowls by dividing cooked brown rice between four bowls. Top each bowl with steamed broccoli florets, shredded carrots, and sliced green onions.
Place a cooked salmon fillet on top of each bowl and sprinkle with sesame seeds for garnish.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.serve_size: 2-3 rolled tortillas, filled with seasoned chicken and cheese, and topped with sauce and additional cheese
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can diced tomatoes with green chilies, drained
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a large bowl, combine shredded chicken, black beans, diced tomatoes with green chilies, chopped onion, chopped bell pepper, chili powder, cumin, and salt. Stir well to combine.
Wrap the tortillas in a damp paper towel and microwave for 20-30 seconds until warm and pliable.
Spoon a generous amount of the chicken mixture into each tortilla and roll up tightly. Place the rolled tortillas seam side down in a baking dish.
Pour the enchilada sauce over the top of the rolled tortillas and sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve hot.

recipes.name: Mushroom Risotto
recipes.serve_size: 1 cup of cooked risotto containing 1/2 to 3/4 cup of uncooked Arborio rice, along with mushrooms, cheese and seasonings.
steps: In a medium saucepan, heat the broth over low heat.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened.
Add the sliced mushrooms to the pot and sauté for 3-4 minutes until tender.
Add the Arborio rice to the pot and stir well to coat with the olive oil and vegetables.
Add the white wine to the pot and stir well. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the wine has been absorbed by the rice.
Add 1 cup of the warm broth to the pot and stir well. Cook, stirring frequently, until the broth has been absorbed by the rice.
Continue adding the broth to the pot, 1 cup at a time, stirring frequently and allowing each addition of broth to be absorbed before adding the next.
Cook the risotto for 20-25 minutes until the rice is tender and creamy.
Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the grated Parmesan cheese and butter.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with chopped fresh parsley. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Greek Salad
recipes.serve_size: 2-3 cups of fresh vegetables along with a small portion of feta cheese, olives and dressing
steps: In a large bowl, combine chopped Romaine lettuce, sliced cucumber, cherry tomatoes, sliced red onion, Kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together red wine vinegar, olive oil, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, and salt and pepper to taste.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to coat.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and oregano, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Shrimp Scampi
recipes.origin: Italy and became popular in USA in the 1900s - 1960s
recipes.serve_size: 4-6 ounces of cooked shrimp along with the sauce and pasta or bread
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the linguine and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Season the shrimp with salt and pepper and coat with flour, shaking off any excess.

In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and cooked through. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the white wine, chicken broth, and lemon juice to the skillet and bring to a simmer. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the sauce has reduced slightly.
Add the cooked linguine and cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss well to coat with the sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Veggie Quesadillas
recipes.serve_size: 1 tortilla filled with a mixture of sauteed vegetables and cheese
ingredients: 1/2 cup canned black beans, drained and rinsed
steps: In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped red onion, bell pepper, and sliced mushrooms, and sauté for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Add the canned black beans, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the skillet, and stir well to combine.

To assemble the quesadillas, place a tortilla on a flat surface. Sprinkle a quarter of the shredded Monterey Jack cheese over one half of the tortilla. Top with a quarter of the sautéed vegetable and black bean mixture. Fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling.
Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat. Add the folded tortilla to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is golden brown and crispy.
Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling.
Cut the quesadillas into wedges and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chocolate Brownies
recipes.serve_size: One square that measures about 2 by 2 inches
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the melted butter, granulated sugar, and unsweetened cocoa powder.
Add the salt, baking powder, and vanilla extract to the bowl and whisk to combine.
Add the eggs to the bowl, one at a time, whisking well after each addition.
Add the all-purpose flour to the bowl and stir with a spatula until just combined. Fold in the semisweet chocolate chips.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean.
Allow the brownies to cool in the pan for 10-15 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.
